available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

onClicked.name: onClicked
onClicked.comment: Fired when a page action icon is clicked. This event will not fire if the page action has a popup.

getPopup.name: getPopup
getPopup.comment: Gets the html document set as the popup for this page action.

getTitle.name: getTitle
getTitle.comment: Gets the title of the page action.

hide.name: hide
hide.comment:
Hides the page action.

chrome/chrome_ext.ChromePageAction.hide.tabId The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

setIcon.name: setIcon
setIcon.comment: Sets the icon for the page action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the <b>path</b> or the <b>imageData</b> property must be specified.

setPopup.name: setPopup
setPopup.comment: Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the page action's icon.

setTitle.name: setTitle
setTitle.comment: Sets the title of the page action. This is displayed in a tooltip over the page action.

show.name: show
show.comment:
Shows the page action. The page action is shown whenever the tab is selected.

chrome/chrome_ext.ChromePageAction.show.tabId The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides chrome/chrome_ext.ChromePageAction.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and chrome/chrome_ext.ChromePageAction.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the chrome/chrome_ext.ChromePageAction.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
chrome/chrome_ext.ChromePageAction.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to chrome/chrome_ext.ChromePageAction.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If chrome/chrome_ext.ChromePageAction.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of chrome/chrome_ext.ChromePageAction.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
